p:
A number of factors are important for a successful commercial production of bioinsecticides:
1.
Large-scale production of viruses at competitive costs.
2.
Economic production of viruses (i.e., low cost for the media and running the culture).
3.
Effective cell line with high virus per cell productivity.
4.
With passage of the virus into cells, there is a loss of virulence and an increased risk of mutant formation; this should be avoided.
5.
The quality of the polyhedral produced in the cell culture should be comparable to those obtained from caterpillars.
